summary: This document is a chain of emails from September 2019 discussing the status of the 'taint review' process for materials seized from Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan residence. The emails are between prosecutors and/or law enforcement agents, coordinating the review of seized evidence and communication with Epstein's defense attorneys regarding search terms.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; materials were seized from his Manhattan residence.

events.title: Materials from Epstein's residence made available
events.description: Materials seized from Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan residence were made available for review.

keyFacts: A 'taint review' was being conducted on materials seized from Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan residence.
The seized materials were made available for review on September 10, 2019.
Epstein's attorneys had provided search terms to be used in the taint review process.
Law enforcement agents were seeking status updates on the review process due to supervisory meetings about the case.
